name: Sugar Hill Cafe
address: 410 W 145th St, New York, NY 10031, USA

reviews.text: I will forever be loyal to Issa and her dedicated team of colorful queers these people not only make delicious breakfast lunch and brunch, they also provide insightful and hilarious commentary on the happenings of my life.
100000/10 ! Je recommande. Le service est au top, la nourriture excellente. Endroit tr√®s chaleureux, nous avons ador√© !
Nice and cozy place for a quick breakfast. Price is reasonable and the food is good, with a friendly staff. Recommend.
This is the most adorable and quaint caf√©! The Coffee and food was delish!!
It‚Äôs very beautiful cute place .
I am so happy I tried this place. The staff were awesome, the coffee is better than two other places I've tried during my vacation and the Italian omelet was the best. Come try for yourself!
Loveeeee Sugar Hill! Such a warm, welcoming environment with the best drinks, the best food, and certainly the best staff! It‚Äôs my go-to spot.
Staff is always super friendly. Coffee and food is supreme, love these guys!
The customer service was 10/10! The atmosphere was cozy and fancy! The perfect place to have your meal any time!
A nice cozy place with great food and drinks. The customer service is 10/10. <333

Sugar Hill Cafe is one of those hole in the wall coffee shops you‚Äôll miss is you‚Äôre not looking for it so GO LOOK FOR IT. The staff is always warm, welcoming, and ready to make their customers smile. They have a surprisingly delicious and expansive menu. And the real draw is the coffee‚Äî it‚Äôs the BEST coffee in the area. Always brewed or steamed to perfection, they get it perfect every time. It‚Äôs good vibes all around
The best place everrrrr the food is amazing!!!!!
Favorite place in the neighborhood to sit with a cup of coffee! Friendly staff, reasonably priced food for the high quality, easy spot to take a break.
Not only is the environment incredibly welcoming, but the service is speedy and efficient. The charisma from each member of the staff truly shifted my desire from eating in the park to dining in.
The cutest little cafe on 145th st. the staff is so kind and welcoming. the food is delicious and the coffee is 10/10! i love sugarhill cafe!
Awesome coffee and French toast. Always good here. Staff always friendly and a nice place to just be. Love the atmosphere. Real cozy.
Low key neighborhood spot , perfect for lunch or weekend brunch
Great local place! The breakfast items are fantastic. Love the Hamilton. The kind of place I take my mom to for a quick brunch bite when she visits the city or grab a quick local cup of coffee.
Very cute spot with warm, friendly staff. Was a great spot to stop in for a weekday breakfast. Interested in checking out their weekend brunch!

I recently visted New York for the first time and Sugar Hill Cafe was one of the highlights of my trip! The drink was delicious, and the service was incredible. I liked it so much that I brought my house mate back with me the second day!
Delightful staff!! One of the warmest receptions from any batistas in Harlem. An excellent spot to hole up against harsher weather and get some work done.
Sugar Hill Cafe is cozy and yummy and the service is lovely!
Everyone who works here is so nice!
I love this place!! Their coffee is amazing but and the servers and baristas are so sweet!
The atmosphere is amazing !! 10/10 service !!
Lovely little neighborhood spot. They have the best seasonal drinks and the food is always consistently good.
Gorgeous, tucked away little coffee spot. Amazing service, and food looks really yummy too. Will definitely be back!
Service is great I always have amazing convos with the baristas!
This is the best place to come to enjoy  a coffee and breakfast or brunch. The service is amazing and they make me feel very confident here. I love it
The service was efficient and everyone was so kind
Love the B Train sandwich. Cozy cafe with nice balance of breakfast items, pastries and coffee
Favorite coffee spot in the area! Very friendly staff who always gives great recommendations! Caramel latte with an extra shot of espresso is my personal favorite!
Good atmosphere.
Love the coffee here.
I love the coffee here.
Absolute favorite coffee and cafe in Hamilton heights! All the baristas are excellent, you‚Äôll get very good lattes every time! They have a full kitchen and food is also excellent!

Jordan and Isabella took incredible care of me; I love stopping in here on my walk to the B/D train in the morning as I head to school but particularly this one morning after a few successive visits, I felt at home in their humor and incredible friendlessness. How else can someone say the Vibes were Immaculate. Please slide. Also, cozy atmosphere inside.

My husband and I had choose to have breakfast at Sugar Hill Cafe and were so glad we did. The staff are incredibly sweet. I had the iced matcha latte and my husband had an iced chai and they were so smooth and not sweet at all. The breakfast we had was very delightful. We highly recommended this cozy cafe!
My favorite morning coffee shop. Best customer service and delicious drinks. Isabella is the sweetest also!

I‚Äôve actually never left a google review before, but I‚Äôve never felt more inclined to do so than after my experience here today. While the food here is decently priced for its quality, I‚Äôve had an unpleasant experience with staff members on multiple occasions. The cafe is very cramped, which can become stressful, but the staff seemed to work against these circumstances, not with them. In today‚Äôs case, I felt that one of the baristas was especially rude to my party for no apparent reason other than the store was crowded. I will personally never come back, and I would never recommend this place to a friend - which is a shame because this place has lots of potential.
Good food and personable staff
I stopped by and got the French toast with fruit and an apple cider latte. So delicious! The staff is so kind and welcoming. The space is calm with ample seating. I definitely recommend stopping by!
Great food! Great atmosphere and lovely service. Perfect spot for brekka or lunch.
Excellent service and drinks!  Lovely breakfast in a warm atmosphere!!  I‚Äôll return!

Lovely spot!
Great atmosphere, great food , great service.
You meet really interesting people.

Loved the place! Unfortunately I got there around 3:30 pm and they closed the kitchen BUT ,got a turkey sandwich, not bad at all and I also got the vanilla caramel iced latte and I absolutely loved it! Customer service was excellent and Loved the vibe!
great service, nice place, delicious chai latte :)

I've been hoping someone would raise the bar locally. The cuisine and employee attention were remarkable. You'll find tasty options that are reasonably priced. Sugar Hill Cafe provided solid service while I enjoyed time with friends. This restaurant provides quality I'm happy to discuss.
Food is excellent and great! Atmosphere is dynamic relaxed.  Customers service excellent very attentive. Great service. Staff is always helpful.
Diner was a nice little spot! Food is delicious and service is great. A little steamy, but definitely warranted. Definitely recommend!

Sugar Hill Cafe is a true gem! The staff are incredibly warm and welcoming ‚Äî they make you feel like family the moment you walk in. The service is fast yet relaxed, and the atmosphere is cozy and inviting.
Their menu is full of delicious options - from fresh pastries to flavorful lattes and creative brunch choices. Every dish is beautifully presented and packed with flavor. Whether you're stopping by for a quick coffee or a leisurely meal, Sugarhill Cafe never disappoints! Highly recommended.

Sugar Hill has been my regular neighborhood cafe for years. I love the breakfast sandwiches and nothing beats the French toast on the weekends after a long night of partying. I also do every morning for a latte and sometimes I try the special drinks, of which the pumpkin spice latte is my fave. It gets really busy for brunch so I recommend going early and often. Prices are typical and the service is always top.

I went and I was met with a small cozy environment which is perfect if you‚Äôre looking for a breakfast place and being able to sit in. I ordered the eggs Bennie and the blackstone eggs and it was a 10/10 !!!!

Delicious caramel latte in a cozy, well lit cafe. Cozy vibe and perfect service.
I went early in the morning, and I enjoyed the quiet, chill vibe. Jalapesto sandwich was filling and tasted great.

Best coffee shop in Harlem! Amazing staff and great vibes. I‚Äôm really impressed with their recent facelift. I‚Äôve been coming for years and my favorite is the Avo Toast. I also go for the double shot of A-train espresso when my body needs a jolt! I also love their newest addition the berry tart. I couldn‚Äôt recommend this hidden gem enough!!!

I love Sugar Hill! Come here all the time to feel the cozy and warm vibes. Around 6 tables to sit/work at. Love the lavender agave latte and their seasonal options! My favorite coffee shop in the area.

I can't resist Sugar Hill Cafe - breakfast is my favorite. I usually go for the eggs - benedict - but the pastries are excellent. They have Plowshares, so local NY coffee, which I appreciate. The staff is also so kind and genuine. Sugar Hill Cafe's owner is a neighbor and has contributed a lot of great ideas and work for the local business group - a real mensch. Recommend!

This caf√© is delightful. The staff is so friendly and a joy to interact with. Their coffee is so flavorful and really gets my workday commute in motion. The decor is supercute and cozy. They also have an amazing community bulletin board which has helped me find community in a neighborhood I‚Äôve only been living in a short time. I highly recommend Sugar Hill Caf√©!

Sugar Hill Cafe is amazing. I‚Äôve been coming here for years and the atmosphere is wonderful. Great for having tea, and coffee or having brunch or lunch. Azara is so lovely and so friendly! The best part is that it‚Äôs close to home and by the train.

My favorite every day coffee shop! Staff is always lovely and makes my drink perfect. Been coming here since I moved here four years ago and it never misses. Food here is great and seasonal items always make it exciting. Must try.

The place is cute and cozy, and I've been here a couple of times. The coffee is quite good, making it a nice spot to enjoy a cup and relax. However, I've noticed that the lady who works here can be in a bad mood sometimes, which affects the vibe a bit. It‚Äôs a small downside to an otherwise pleasant coffee shop experience.

Azara is a delight! Azara and Blue made my first experience back at Sugar Hill an EXPERIENCE. It‚Äôs a chill spot with great service and delish breakfast options. The energy in here makes the place a nice start to my day.

Went before work, ordered the Sugar hill breakfast.
The person was busy serving coffee
My plate was left on the counter until it was cold.
Not the best experience
Wasn‚Äôt able to enjoy it
Went across the street to get a hot sandwich

Sugarhill Cafe has truly become my go-to spot in New York, and for good reason! First and foremost, their coffee is fantastic ‚Äì consistently rich, flavorful, and expertly brewed. Whether I'm grabbing a quick espresso or lingering over a perfectly crafted cappuccino with its velvety smooth microfoam, I'm never disappointed. And speaking of treats, you absolutely must try their blueberry cheesecake. The creamy texture, the bursts of sweet and tart blueberries, and that buttery crust create a truly divine experience. It pairs perfectly with their cappuccino, making for an ideal little indulgence.
But what elevates Sugarhill Cafe from just a good coffee shop to a truly exceptional one is their excellent customer service. From the moment you walk in, you're greeted with genuine warmth and a smile. The baristas are not only efficient but also incredibly friendly and attentive. They remember your order, offer helpful suggestions, and create a welcoming atmosphere that makes you feel like a valued regular. Even during the hustle and bustle of the city, they maintain a sense of calm and care. You leave Sugarhill Cafe not just with a delicious coffee and perhaps a slice of that incredible blueberry danish, but also with a feeling of having been genuinely looked after. It's a delightful neighborhood gem that offers both quality and exceptional service ‚Äì highly, highly recommended!

Really fantastic service, great food, tasty coffee. Grace and Isabella made our day‚Äî best baristas in NYC. They also have a stand to support local artists just inside the front door. Stop by for brunch and drinks!
This is my number one coffee place ever in my whole life. Isabella is the best barista and cook I‚Äôve ever met. I come here every day before and after school.

Sugar Hill Cafe is a cozy place for work or socializing (or both!) with reliably yummy offerings. But what made me want to write this review today is to shout out Azara for her uniquely awesome service my last visit. Friendly, warm, and welcoming are understatements. Being treated like family truly made my day. Will be sure to return soon.
I really enjoy stopping here for my flat white before heading on the train. The service here has been nothing but an incredible experience. I can‚Äôt wait to be back tomorrow!

Stepping into Sugarhill Cafe is always a little bright spot in my day here in the city. They truly nail the coffee ‚Äì it's consistently delicious, with a rich aroma and satisfying flavor. Their cappuccino, in particular, is a real treat; the espresso has a lovely depth, and the milk is steamed to a perfect, silky texture.
Beyond the excellent brews, their blueberry danish is something special. It's got this wonderful creamy richness punctuated by juicy bursts of blueberry, all resting on a beautifully crumbly base. Trust me, it's the kind of dessert you'll want to savor slowly. Pairing it with their expertly made cappuccino is just chef's kiss ‚Äì the flavors complement each other perfectly.
However, what really makes Sugarhill Cafe stand out is their top-notch customer service. The team there is just so welcoming and friendly. They're efficient and attentive, always ready with a smile and a kind word. It's clear they take pride in what they do and genuinely appreciate their customers. In a city where interactions can sometimes feel rushed, Sugarhill Cafe offers a refreshing sense of community and care. It's more than just a coffee shop; it's a place where you feel good from the moment you walk in. If you're looking for fantastic coffee, delectable treats, and truly outstanding service, Sugarhill Cafe is a must-visit!
Thank you SHC crew for the best espresso shot in the hood! Grace was extremely hospitable and her friendliness is contagious! I highly recommend this spot as it is a staple in this neighborhood.

I really love this place! The food and coffee are top notch. Love the avocado toast and the B-train. Their drip coffee is üòÆ‚Äçüí®üòÆ‚Äçüí®. I‚Äôve been going there for some time my two favorite baristas are Grace and Isabella. They are quirky, fun and always make my mornings before work feel special. ‚ù§Ô∏è

Came in with family members for the first time. The French Toast was delicious as were all our hot drinks. The rest of us ordered egg dishes- Omelette and Eggs Benedict. Our meals were not hot, luke warm at best. We told them we were dining in, and would be using the outside seating. We had to go inside to grab our meals as they didn't bring it to us. We also cleaned our own tables. You have the order/pay first, if we had known they didn't serve the food/clean the tables, we wouldn't have left a tip when ordering.
The vibes of the caf√© were incredible. Azara and isa provided great service and were very hospitable hosts ! Loved the une matcha and will definitely be back

This is an adorable place tucked under the street! Blink and you‚Äôll miss it so watch for the sign on the wall.

Pleasant staff, warm and atmosphere. Large variety of food and beverages choices. I only had coffee, but I loved just being in the space.

It‚Äôs not large and not accessible due to stairs, but a great place to stop and study.

I‚Äôm a black coffee person. And by that, I mean I‚Äôm a coffee snob, and grind my own beans (you can roll your eyes, I do). But the vanilla caramel latte I had here is what I wish all lattes I‚Äôve ever had could be. The only better coffee I‚Äôve had in life was an egg coffee in Vietnam, so if you‚Äôre not planning on heading there for brunch I‚Äôd recommend getting a coffee here.

The service is super lovely, friendly, and the atmosphere is cosy. I also noticed the few times I‚Äôve popped in that there are constant regulars who seem to know everyone well. In a time of impersonal coffee chains, it‚Äôs so nice to have a feeling of true community in the form of a neighborhood coffee shop.

Edited to add: I just tried the Korean omelette because it was recommended. I‚Äôm not an omelette fan but I eat for health so I figured I‚Äôd try it. I‚Äôm not kidding when I say this is the most beautifully flavoured omelette I‚Äôve ever had.  It‚Äôs not too subtle and not too much, and I‚Äôm afraid I‚Äôll have to be make a whole new omelette budget in my life now‚Ä¶.

Great vibe and great food! Highly recommend the French Toast, it was crunchy and so delicious. The eggs Benedict and the mimosas were great too. The coffee was nice and strong and the baristas were amazing. It was also not packed on a Saturday at 1:00pm.

I think it's Me. I think I (hope) that people are happy to be in the service industry. Sadly I am realizing that isn't always the case.

We came here for breakfast this past Saturday 7.6.24 myself, Little Bit and my grandkids it was like pulling teeth to get more simple syrup for my Arnold Palmer and when I asked specifically that my Eggs Benedict 'poached' eggs be prepared runny... I received a look of "well of duh" yet they weren't runny. I will say this though the hollandaise sauce was on POINT and the bacon was good too. My bad that I didn't realize (nor apparently read) that it didn't come with a crumpet or english muffin as it's vessel LOL

The french toast was sooooo good too oh and the breakfast potatoes Manifique! All in all if you are in the area and you want something tasty that hit's the spot in your tummy come here! Street parking can be found and it's a short walk from the subway station. They have outdoor seating but we moseyed our way down the steps to where the restaurant was and sat inside. They had a communal table as well as 2 tops and (1) 4 in the rear by the restroom. Air conditioning too for these hot summer months is always a plus while dining.

Respectfully Reviewed.

A chill vibe and good food is what you‚Äôll find at this place. I had the peppermint mocha, cold brew, and the green omelette. I was extremely happy with the food. It had a perfect balance and was cooked just right. They have a decent cook.‚Ä¶

This is my first time at Sugar hill Cafe, despite living in the neighborhood. I loved the kindness and honesty from the employee. I ordered "The sophisticated" avocado toast and it is SCRUMPTIOUS. Lastly, I loved working here. I did not feel pressured to buy or rush! My only suggestion would be getting gluten free options.  Despite that, I highly recommend this cafe.

I‚Äôm genuinely confused by all the glowing reviews. We expected a hidden gem with friendly service and good food, but instead got chaos in slow motion.

Coffee took 20 minutes, the staff kept forgetting our order, and food arrived without utensils ‚Äî when I asked, I was told they ran out of clean ones.
Unfortunately, the food and coffee weren‚Äôt good either.

I really love the cozy, inviting vibe of this cafe. The space is small but charming, with a warm atmosphere that feels perfect for a relaxed morning or catching up with a friend. They offer a wide variety of brunch options, and everything I‚Äôve tried has been delicious. The service is friendly, definitely a spot I‚Äôd come back to.
It‚Äôs a vibe, and a great one at that. Great coffee, great people and they now have ube lattes too (perfect for AAPI month). Thanks for being a gem in Hamilton Heights!
Este lugar es muy acojedor. El personal muy amigable y el cafe delicioso. Creo que volvere porque me senti muy bien!!!

The coffee here is excellent, and they cycle through a lot of cool unique lattes etc. that all taste AMAZING. But the real five stars comes from the people here ‚Äî all are so kind and fun and make the cafe feel like a cozy apartment. Talk to Isa, Grace Blue or Trent for just a couple minutes and your day will be better üåû This is def my favorite spot to hang out.

I have been coming to this cafe for years now and I love it. The new barista Azara is so sweet she knows me by name and she is always so pleasant when I see her. She also keeps the vibe in the cafe super cool with a good playlist.

I had a specialty coffee (peppermint mocha) that had good flavor and was reasonably priced.

The space is small but has a lot of character. They have an extensive menu with drinks and food. The food looked great and I would get it next time I go!

Update:
Got the iced chai latte and it‚Äôs decent (see photo). The iced vanilla latte is good!
Azara was so sweet and kind, she took care of us and made me an amazing drink. I always love coming to sugar hill and have been coming for years! The staff is great! Definitely stop by!
